isis.stitle: NEWAY AIR SUSPENSION - RIDE HEIGHT ADJUSTMENT

svcproc.title: RIDE HEIGHT ADJUSTMENT
svcproc.para: Prior to adjustment, the vehicle must be unloaded.

warning.para: A jack must never be used alone to support vehicle while under-chassis service is being performed. The jack may lower and serious personal injury could result. Always support vehicle with floor stands.

step1.para: Disconnect linkages at lower brackets, push the control arms to the "up" position and raise the vehicle.

step2.para: Position the jack stands (one on each side) at proper ride height between the truck frame and the ground. Refer to RIDE HEIGHT DIMENSION/ CODES CHART, for jack stand and ride height dimensions.

note.para: Jack stand height is predicated on 10:00 x 20/11:22.5 tires with an unloaded radius of 20.5". If a different size tire is used, the difference in radius must be added or subtracted from the jack stand height.

step2.para: With the jack stands safely in position, push the control arms to the "down" position lowering the vehicle and deflating all air from the air springs and the vehicle system.

note.para: It may be necessary to shim the jack stands to achieve proper ride height.

step1.para: Move the control arms to a 45 degree "down" position for 10 to 15 seconds. Return the control arms slowly to the center position and insert the wood locating pins (3/16 inch dowel rod) into the adjusting block and bracket on the height control valves. Repeat this procedure on the opposite valve.
Loosen the 1/4" adjusting lock nuts located on the adjusting blocks. This will allow the control arms to oscillate approximately ± 1". Connect the linkage (removed in Step 1) to the lower brackets.
Tighten the 1/4" adjusting lock nuts at the adjusting blocks to 2 to 4 ft-lbs. (2.7 to 5.4 N•m) Complete this operation on both valves.

Remove the wood locating pins that were inserted in Step 2 and raise the vehicle to remove the jack stands. The height control valves may be used as a jack, whereas the linkage must be disconnected at the lower bracket.

step2.para: Push the control arms to an "up" position to raise the vehicle and remove the jack stands.
Push the control arms to a "down" position and completely exhaust the air from the system.
Connect the lower linkage and build air in the system to normal operating pressure. The suspension will return to and maintain the proper ride height.
